content: Today, the company reported a net income of $771,000 or $0.22 per share for the quarter ended June 30, 2022 compared to net income of $3,323,000, or $0.09 per share in the same quarter last year. Last year's quarter included $133,000 or $0.04 per share from gains on real estate net of income tax. Operating revenues for the quarter were $23,501,000 up $2,646,000 from the same quarter last year due to rate increases and higher fuel surcharges. Depreciation expense was down $299,000 in the quarter and gains on sale of assets was $163,000 compared to $46,000 in last year's quarter. The operating profit for this quarter was $913,000 compared to $269,000, excluding gains on real estate sales in last year's third quarter. Diesel prices have increased to record levels causing our fuel expense to increase by $2,713,000 over last year while insurance and losses increased by $462,000 due mainly to a maximum limit COVID claim of $372,500 and the negative worker's compensation adjustment on a prior year claim of $380,000. Excluding the Tampa land sale and the one time transaction bonus per management adjusted operating profit for the nine months was $879,000 compared to an adjusted operating loss of $792,000 in the same period last year.
